abstract.para: This topic outlines the complete workflow to deploy the &productnameshort; product. It aims to clarify the deployment process to get good understanding of its complexity, find minimum hardware requirements, and steps to take after the deployment.

itemizedlist.para: Before deploying &productnameshort;, you must complete the following tasks:

listitem.para: For basic functionality, &productnameshort; has the same hardware requirements as the &rke2; distribution with at least 32 GB of RAM. Refer to for details.

To use the &nvidia; GPU Operator, you need a compatible GPU hardware. Refer to
for details.

step.para: Install and register &slm; 6.0 or later on each &rke2; cluster node. Refer to for details.

If you plan to utilize the computing power of &nvidia; GPUs, install the &nvidia; GPU driver on cluster nodes with GPUs. Refer to
for details.

Install the &nvidia;container toolkit on GPU enabled systems. Refer to
for details.
Install &rke2; &kube; distribution on the cluster nodes. Refer to for details.

Connect the &rke2; cluster to &ranchermanager;. Refer to
for details.
Configure the GPU enabled nodes so that the &productnameshort; containers are assigned to Pods that run on nodes equipped with &nvidia; GPU hardware. Find more details assigning Pods to nodes in .
If you previously installed the &nvidia; GPU driver on hosts with GPU hardware, install &nvoperator; with the additional option --set driver.enabled=false. Refer to .
Configure &ssecurity; to scan the nodes used for &productnameshort;. Although this step is not required, we strongly encourage it to ensure the security in production environment.
Configure &sobservability; to observe the nodes used for &productnameshort; application.
Open the &ranchermanager; Web UI in your Web browser, log in with your credentials, and navigate to the Application Collection.

From the list of available applications, select &productnameshort;. The Application Collection performs the entitlement check and when successful, you are given access to &productnameshort; &helm; charts and container images.

Click the Install button in the top right. The installer guides you through the installation steps, where you can specify custom &helm; options, for example. On the last installer page, confirm the installation with Install at the bottom right.

section.title: Steps after the installation is complete

step.para: Log in to &productnameshort; &openwebui; using the default credentials.
After you have logged in, update the administrator password for &productnameshort;.
From the available language models, configure the one you prefer. Optionally, install a custom language model.
Configure user management RBAC and SSO (https://docs.openwebui.com/tutorials/features/sso)
Configure RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) to include content relevant to the customer use case in results (https://docs.openwebui.com/tutorials/features/rag)
